data.title: Different Rendering of Shortcut keys
data.body:
Testing #23287

The rendering of shortcuts differs in the contribution view of the ext manager:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/24467421/30faf302-1469-11e7-84f3-0718bca11637.png)

And the keyboard shortcut editor:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/24467432/3fbbd262-1469-11e7-9ecb-639ff8052e87.png)

We should ideally make the views as consistant as possible e.g the column headers, the command description layout and the key highlighting.

data.title: Enhanced Scrollbar with Marks and Annotations (like VisualStudio)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Feature Request

Add more options to the previously added Enhanced Scrollbar feature which added Minimap functionality. This is a great way to easily see areas that have changed, code that is or is not saved, code that has been undone, etc. The ESLint extension already adds green and red marks to indicate problems and errors, so it should be possible to add the annotation marks from VisualStudio 2015+.
![enhanced_scrollbar_annotations](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26094186/24466172/c3200a74-1464-11e7-8fee-0ab27e95818b.PNG)

In the picture, yellow is unsaved, blue is reverted code that is unsaved, green is a resharper suggestion (as with the orange bar), and red is a compile error.

If this is already an extension or an option, I could not find it.

data.title: prevent reload window closes the debuggee; fixes #23390
data.body:
I cannot reproduce the problem when running out of source, so I could not really verify that the fix works.

`environmentService.debugExtensionHost.break` is used for two things: 1) as an indication that debug mode is active and 2) it indicates that break mode is active. The first use is now broken, because debug mode can be enabled with the command line flag `--debugPluginHost` too.  This dual use forbids that we can just add a test for `--debugPluginHost` when parsing the value from the command line. For this reason I'm following @bpasero's suggestion to use the `debugExtensionHost.port` as an indication that debug mode is active.

data.title: Typescript symbols aren't displayed when using `"search.quickOpen.includeSymbols": true`
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (d98a518c5485bd7a47c70f5b3783f70efa5edcd6, 2017-03-29T06:05:18.022Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0

Following the rules in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23584. Typescript symbols don't seem to show up in the quick open list (when using `"search.quickOpen.includeSymbols": true`), while C# symbols do.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder with Typescript & C# files
2. Open a Typescript file
3. Open a C# file
3. Do a symbol search for a known Typescript or C# symbol
4. Results will be displayed
5. Do a quick open search of the same as #3
6. C# symbols will be displayed, while Typescript ones will not

data.title: 'Go to Symbol in Workspace' doesn't work unless an editor of the language is open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (d98a518c5485bd7a47c70f5b3783f70efa5edcd6, 2017-03-29T06:05:18.022Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0

`Go to Symbol in Workspace` only seems to work if there is at least one editor of a particular language open. For example, in order to get workspace symbols in Typescript, I need to have at least 1 Typescript file open, same with C#. If I have no editors open then there no symbols are shown.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder (Typescript, C#, a mix, etc)
2. With no editors open, do a symbol search for a known symbol
3. No results will be displayed


1. Open a folder with more than 1 language (Typescript & C# for instance)
2. Open a Typescript file
3. Do a symbol search for a known Typescript symbol
4. Results will be displayed
5. Do a symbol search for a known C# symbol
6. No results will be displayed
7. Open a C# file
8. Do a symbol search for a known C# symbol
9. Results will be displayed

data.title: Hard to find settings with new IntelliSense sorting
data.body:
I find the new sorting in IntelliSense quite bad for settings where I typically do not think about camel case matching but rather the name of the setting in words:

The most relevant entries when I type "close" for me are now at the end of the list:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/24463162/dd3ae028-145a-11e7-9fac-2cf0d241e3c3.png)

Stable:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/24463224/055b6cda-145b-11e7-9c34-e3f1fa95ea0f.png)

Either those 2 entries should be sorted to the top or we disable fuzzy scoring for settings at least.

/cc @Microsoft/vscode for input

data.title: Standalone editor coloring issues
data.body:
* clone https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor next to vscode
* `monaco-editor` and `vscode` should be sibling folders
* run `gulp watch` as usual in `vscode`
* run `npm install .` in `monaco-editor`
* open `monaco-editor/test/index.html` in a browser (file protocol will do)
* click on `dev` next to monaco-editor the url should now contain `?editor=dev`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/24462986/49a5790e-145a-11e7-9039-cd330e4d7c88.png)

data.title: [scss] hide functions that don't match type
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file with an .scss file extension
2. Type "position: re" or "position: ab" to bring up intellisense suggestions
3. Default values of "red" and "abs" are not valid values for the position property

This is not an issue with .css files so seems to be an issue with .scss files.

data.title: Allow to associate a file encoding per file path
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 8.1-Pro

Here is a gif of the bug in action: 
![vscode-fileencode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1530028/24415489/a2e93236-13af-11e7-9b70-b74938f8c1fb.gif)
TXT Files refrenced: [iso-8859-1.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/876495/iso-8859-1.txt) and [shift-jis.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/876496/shift-jis.txt)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the attached text files with the corresponding encoding.
2. Verify the characters display properly and the encoding is correct in the bottom-right corner of VS code.
3. (Re)Save the files using the same encoding.
4. Close the files.
5. Open the files normally (Without specifying the encoding).
6. The encoding used to open the files is not the same encoding used to save the files. The characters do not display properly.
7. Enabling `files.autoGuessEncoding` does not resolve the issue, but it does change which encoding is guessed.

Note that if I run `file -bi iso-8859-1.txt` from Git Bash, I can see the correct encoding is returned.

data.title: Working with virtualenvs created by bash on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607

Not sure if this belongs as part of VS code or Python extension.
Is there a way to be able to use virtualenvs created by the Bash terminal for Windows?

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
2. run **virtuarenv ve** inside **C:\\...\my-workspace-folder**
3. Add **${workspaceRoot}/ve/bin/python3** to pythonpath in settings and launch.json
4. Run debugger 
5. Produces **C:\\...\my-workspace-folder\ve\bin\python3 ENOENT** error

data.title: Getting hold of current launch configuration in the extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Question: is it possible to get hold of the active launch configuration from the extension code?
In other words, get hold of debugService.getViewModel().selectedConfigurationName

In our scenario, launch configurations point to different remote servers with which the users can work. Now,  we would like to have another custom extension command which should work with the "current" server.
Therefore I need to get hold of the currently selected configuration name and then I can find the actual configuration myself.
